alert.note: Alert for St. Louis; St. Louis City (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 17 at 3:52AM CDT until July 17 at 6:15AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL SAINT LOUIS COUNTY AND THE SOUTHERN SAINT LOUIS CITY... At 352 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain have moved out of the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... St. Louis, Kirkwood, Webster Groves, Arnold, Cahokia, Crestwood, Richmond Heights, Ladue, Sunset Hills, Des Peres, Brentwood, Maplewood, Valley Park, Shrewsbury, Glendale, Fenton, Warson Woods, Lakeshire, Oakland and Affton. This includes Interstate 44 in Missouri between exits 274 and 277. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
